page.title: 06PETROCKSTOWE SCHOOL CHILDREN
page.content: The Church School in{Petrockstowe, which had two classes of 20-25 pupils, closed in l960 because the Church did not keep up the repairs. The site now accommodates the village hall,{Baxter {Hall,}where a pre-school Playgroup for some 18 children under 5 is organised. The local schoolchildren have to travel 2 miles to Merton to attend {Clinton Primary School,}or 6 miles to Great Torrington for the{Comprehensive {Secondary School. }Pupils for the latter travel by school bus, leaving home at around 7.30 am. 50% of the schoolchildren will continue their education beyond the compulsory age of 16, 60% to attend Technical College, 40% aiming for a University course. Further education is available at Bideford, Torrington and Beaford (5-12 miles), both evening and day classes being held.
